snippet: There were 3.8 million job openings at the end of June, up 105,000 from the previous month and the most since July 2008.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column discusses the rise in the number of jobs available in the United States reaching its highest level in four years; Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that there were 3.8 million job openings at the end of June, up 105,000 from the previous month and the most since July 2008.
lead_paragraph: There were 3.8 million job openings at the end of June, up 105,000 from the previous month and the most since July 2008.

headline.print_headline: A Hopeful Sign: Job Openings Rise
headline.seo: Number of Jobs Available Rises to a 4-Year High - Off the Charts
headline.main: A Hopeful Sign: Job Openings Rise
